meanings.sent1: The dog crapped in the yard.
meanings.sent2: I crapped before leaving the house.
meanings.sent3: He crapped in the bushes, thinking no one would notice.
meanings.sent4: The bird crapped on my car windshield.
meanings.sent5: She crapped quickly, not wanting to be late for work.

meanings.sent1: After breakfast, he crapped in the bathroom.
meanings.sent2: She crapped regularly to stay healthy.
meanings.sent3: The cat crapped in its litter box, feeling relieved.
meanings.sent4: The baby crapped loudly, causing everyone to laugh.
meanings.sent5: They crapped together, a sign of their strong friendship.

meanings.definition: To have a bad experience or outcome.
meanings.sent1: I crapped my presentation in front of the whole class.
meanings.sent2: He crapped his chances of winning by making a mistake.
meanings.sent3: The team crapped the game, losing in the final seconds.
meanings.sent4: She crapped her interview by being unprepared.
meanings.sent5: The weather crapped our plans for a picnic.
